title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble (AEME) package allows setup run ensemble aquatic ecosystem models. models DYRESM-CAEDYM, GLM-AED GOTM-WET.

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: can install development version AEME GitHub :

title: Aquatic Ecosystem Model Ensemble
text: basic example shows build run one models ensemble: model input output (/O) handled ’s S4 object class aeme. allows standardisation generalisation functions class alongside ensuring integrity validity ’s structure. allows easier handling model output data within structure allows condensed output printed console: Summarised easily: Model data can visualised easily using plot_output() function Also, visualising lake level plots.
code: library(AEME) #>  #> Attaching package: 'AEME' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     time ## basic example code tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") #> Linking to GEOS 3.11.2, GDAL 3.6.2, PROJ 9.2.0; sf_use_s2() is FALSE #> Warning in aeme_constructor(lake = yaml$lake, catchment = yaml$catchment, : Lake area [152343 m2] is different to the area calculated from the lake #> shape [152433.09 m2]. mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1) outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1) model <- c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet") aeme_data <- build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5, use_bgc = TRUE, use_lw = TRUE) #> Building simulation for Wainamu [2023-09-05 12:39:16.413652] #> Using observed water level #> Estimating title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
code: build_ensemble(   aeme_data = NULL,   config = NULL,   model = c("dy_cd", "glm_aed", "gotm_wet"),   mod_ctrls,   inf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   outf_factor = c(glm_aed = 1, dy_cd = 1, gotm_wet = 1),   ext_elev = 0,   use_bgc = TRUE,   use_lw = TRUE,   coeffs = NULL,   hum_type = 3,   path = "." )

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. config list; loaded via `config <- yaml::read_yaml("aeme.yaml")` model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. mod_ctrls dataframe; configuration loaded "mod_ctrls.csv". inf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple inflows. Needs named according model. outf_factor vector; containing numeric factor multiple outflows. Needs named according model. ext_elev numeric; extension elevation hypsogrph metres. use_bgc boolean; switch use biogeochemical model. use_lw boolean; use incoming longwave radiation. applies GLM-AED. coeffs numeric vector length two; used estimate surface water temperature estimating evaporation. Defaults NULL. water temperature observations included `aeme` object, use build linear relationship air temperature water temperature. Otherwise. uses simple estimation  \(temp_water = 5 + 0.75 * temp_air\) Stefan & Preud'homme, 2007:  www.doi.org/10.1111/j.1752-1688.1993.tb01502.x hum_type numeric; GOTM humidity metric [1=relative humidity ( 2=wet-bulb temperature, 3=dew point temperature, 4=specific humidity (kg/kg)] Default = 3. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
text: builds model ensemble configuration. aeme object

title: Build model configuration directories — build_ensemble
code: install.packages("configr", repos = "http://cran.us.r-project.org") #> Installing package into ‘/tmp/Rtmp6yvUhV/temp_libpath1c90613fc634’ #> (as ‘lib’ is unspecified) #> also installing the dependencies ‘ini’, ‘RcppTOML’ tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) #> [1] TRUE path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") #> Linking to GEOS 3.10.2, GDAL 3.4.1, PROJ 8.2.1; sf_use_s2() is FALSE #> Warning: Lake area [152343 m2] is different to the area calculated from the lake #> shape [152433.09 m2]. mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) outf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) model <- c("glm_aed") build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                use_bgc = FALSE, use_lw = TRUE) #> Building simulation for Wainamu [2023-09-22 02:12:39.848954] #> Using observed water level #> Estimating temperature using Stefan & Preud'homme (2007)... #> Building GLM3-AED2 model for lake wainamu #> Copied in GLM nml file #> Warning: NAs introduced by coercion #> 			   AEME  #> ------------------------------------------------------------------- #>   Lake #> Wainamu (ID: 45819); title: Plot AEME output — plot_output
code: if (FALSE) {   tmpdir <- tempdir()   aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME")   # Copy files from package into tempdir   file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE)   path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake")   aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml")   mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv"))   inf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   outf_factor = c("dy_cd" = 1, "glm_aed" = 1, "gotm_wet" = 1)   #'   model <- c("glm_aed", "gotm_wet")   build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                  mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                  use_bgc = TRUE, use_lw = TRUE)   run_aeme(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, verbose = FALSE, path = path,            parallel = TRUE)    aeme_data <- load_output(model = model, aeme_data = aeme_data, path = path,                            mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, parallel = TRUE)    p1 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                     var_sim = "HYD_temp", level = TRUE, label = TRUE,                     print_plots = FALSE, var_lims = c(0, 30),                     ylim = c(0, 16))   p1[[1]]    p2 <- plot_output(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                     var_sim = "HYD_evap", print_plots = TRUE,                     ylim = c(0, 0.02)) }

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
text: aeme_data aeme; data object. model vector; models used. Can `dy_cd`, `glm_aed`, `gotm_wet`. return logical; return model output within `aeme` object? Defaults TRUE. mod_ctrls dataframe; configuration loaded "mod_ctrls.csv". nlev numeric; number levels return model output. NULL, calculates number levels based lake depth provided within hypsograph. lake less thatn 3m deep, outputs every 0.1m, else greater 3m, outputs every 0.33m. Defaults NULL. verbose logical; print model output console. Defaults FALSE. debug logical; write debug log (DYRESM). Defaults FALSE. timeout timeout seconds, ignored 0.  limit     elapsed time running command separate process.   Fractions     seconds ignored. parallel logical; run models parallel. Defaults FALSE. check_output logical; check model output running? Defaults FALSE. path filepath; input files located relative `config`.

title: Run aquatic model ensemble — run_aeme
code: if (FALSE) { tmpdir <- tempdir() aeme_dir <- system.file("extdata/lake/", package = "AEME") # Copy files from package into tempdir file.copy(aeme_dir, tmpdir, recursive = TRUE) path <- file.path(tmpdir, "lake") aeme_data <- yaml_to_aeme(path = path, "aeme.yaml") mod_ctrls <- read.csv(file.path(path, "model_controls.csv")) inf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) outf_factor = c("glm_aed" = 1) model <- c("glm_aed") build_ensemble(path = path, aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model,                mod_ctrls = mod_ctrls, inf_factor = inf_factor, ext_elev = 5,                use_bgc = TRUE, use_lw = TRUE) run_aeme(aeme_data = aeme_data, model = model, verbose = TRUE, path = path,           return = FALSE) }

code: if (FALSE) { config_file <- system.file("extdata/feeagh/LakeEnsemblR.yaml", package = "LakeEnsemblR")  yaml <- read_yaml(config_file) yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = 23, key1 = "location", key2 = "latitude") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = "2010-06-01 00:00:00", key1 = "time", key2 = "start") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = "meteo.csv", key1 = "input", key2 = "meteo", key3 = "file") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = TRUE, key1 = "calibration", key2 = "GOTM", key3 = "turb_param/k_min", key4 = "log") yaml <- set_yaml(yaml, value = c("temp", "salt"), key1 = "output", key2 = "variables")  write_yaml(yaml, "LakeEnsemblR.yaml") }
